policy_rule: The confidentiality obligation must last for at least 3 years.
The liability cap must not exceed 1.5x the total fees paid.
Provider must not sell or commercialize Client Data without explicit consent.
Termination must require at least 30 days notice or payment in lieu.
Indemnity should not cover the Provider's own negligence or willful misconduct.
Provider must provide an uptime guarantee and not suspend services arbitrarily.
Provider must take reasonable responsibility for protecting Client Data stored on its servers.
Provider must provide refunds or remedies for extended outages or breaches.
Contract must be governed by a recognized legal jurisdiction and not by internal policies only.
Dispute resolution must allow independent arbitration or judicial review.
